info.title: Shore API
info.description:
Welcome to the Shore API. You can use our API to access your [Shore](https://www.shore.com) data.
  
Our API conforms to conventions found in many other modern [REST](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_State_Transfer) API's. We follow the standard use of HTTP response codes and HTTP verbs. [JSON](http://www.json.org/) is returned by all responses. We support [cross-origin resource sharing](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-origin_resource_sharing) which enables you to make requests from client-side or server-side code (see the [Authentication](#authentication) section on how to securely make requests from client-side code).
  
We strive for a high level of consistency and flexibility in our API. To that end, all of our endpoints conform to a published specification. Namely, our  authentication endpoints conform to the [OAuth2](https://oauth.net/2/) specification and all other endpoints conform to the [JSON API](http://jsonapi.org/) specification.

# Authentication

All API requests must be authenticated. Requests made from server-side code can authenticate via  [basic authentication](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication). Set the username to your account's API Token. You do not need to provide a password. You can manage your API Tokens in your [Account Settings](https://my.shore.com/merchant/account).
  
```
$ curl https://api.shore.com/v2/customers \
    -u BUyTwydpe4tT3DTpTiBt 
```


**Keep your API Token secret**. Do not use your API Token in client-side code (e.g. javascript in a web browser, iOS/Android mobile code, etc.). Use the provided [OAuth2 endpoint](#request-a-token) instead. Store your API Token in a secure location for your server-side code.
 
Client-side requests must use our [OAuth2 endpoint](#request-a-token) to obtain an [access token](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.4) and a [refresh token](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.5) in exchange for the user's credentials.
  
Obtain the user's credentials via an input form. **DO NOT** store the username and password in your code . 
  
```
$ curl -X POST https://api.shore.com/v2/tokens \
    -d "grant_type=password" \
    -d "username=email@mail.com" \
    -d "password=secret"
    
{
  "access_token":"eyJ0eXAiOiJKV.eyJzdWIiOiJj.T-J6Hkxh",
  "token_type":"bearer",
  "expires_in":3600,
  "refresh_token":"QyNi01NDIxLTRjZ.OiJjZjc3OGQyNi01N.RYRz1iSm2J5qm1BgDe0"
}
```

Authenticate the request by passing the `access_token` in the Authorization header:

```
$ curl https://api.shore.com/v2/customers \
    -H "Authorization=Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV.eyJzdWIiOiJj.T-J6Hkxh"
```

The same `access_token` can be used until it expires. After it expires, you can obtain a new one using the `refresh_token`.

```
$ curl -X POST https://api.shore.com/v2/tokens \
    -d "grant_type=refresh_token" \
    -d "refresh_token=QyNi01NDIxLTRjZ.OiJjZjc3OGQyNi01N.RYRz1iSm2J5qm1BgDe0"
```

# JSON API

Our API conforms to the [JSON API](http://jsonapi.org/format/) specification which describes the format of both the requests and the responses. Unless stated otherwise, each section below defines a [JSON API Resource Object](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects).

Each section contains the following information:
 
* Description of what this resource object is
* List of [JSON API features](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching) supported by this resource object (e.g. [inclusion of related resources](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-includes), [sparse fieldsets](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-sparse-fieldsets), [sorting](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-sorting), [pagination](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination) and [filtering](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-filtering))
* List of [JSON API attributes and relationships](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects)
 for this resource object.
     
# Errors

Errors are a combination of HTTP status codes and [JSON API conform response bodies](http://jsonapi.org/examples/#error-objects).

# Use postman for testing

If you are just getting started, an easy way to explore the endpoints is by creating an application using following instructions below.

1. Download [Postman](https://getpostman.com) and click the **Run in Postman** button at the top of this page. This will load our collection of endpoints into Postman for easy debugging.
2. In Postman, under the collection edit panel, click the **Authorization** tab. Choose OAuth 2.0, click the Get New Access Token button. Set Access Token URL to https://api.shore.com/v2/tokens. Add the username (email) and password from your Shore account, then click Request Token.

Alternatively you can set up your credentials in **Variables** tab under edit collection panel. Then just get a token from **Request token** request and set up `access_token` variable.

get.description:
Parameters:

+ **filter[merchant]** : `08d4cace-d873-4bb2-999e-883b102a4df6` (optional)
Comma separated list of merchant id(s).
    + Default: All merchants available for requesting account.
+ **filter[merchant_accounts]** : `08d4cace-d873-4bb2-999e-883b102a4df6` (optional)
Comma separated list of merchant_account id(s).
    + Default: All appointments from merchants accounts that the signed in merchant account has access to.
+ **filter[starts_at.gt]** : `2017-01-15T23:00:00.000Z` (optional)
`ISO 8601`. Appointments that start after the given date and time.
    + Default: All appointments.
+ **filter[starts_at.lt]** : `2017-01-15T23:00:00.000Z` (optional)
`ISO 8601`. Appointments that start before the given date and time.
    + Default: All appointments.
+ **filter[ends_at.gt]** : `2017-01-15T23:00:00.000Z` (optional)
`ISO 8601`. Appointments that end after the given date and time.
    + Default: All appointments.
+ **filter[ends_at.lt]** : `2017-01-15T23:00:00.000Z` (optional)
`ISO 8601`. Appointments that end before the given date and time.
    + Default: All appointments.
+ **filter[created_by_merchant]** : `true,false` (boolean, optional)
Boolean to filter if an appointment was created by merchant or not
    + Default: All appointments.
+ **filter[deleted]** : true,false (boolean, optional) Comma separated boolean to filter appointments that were soft deleted. Send `true,false` when you want to display all of the appointments (deleted or not).
    + Default: `true,false`.
+ **filter[created_at.gt]** : `2021-01-15T23:00:00.000Z` (optional)
`ISO 8601`. Appointments that was created after the given date and time.
    + Default: All appointments.
+ **filter[created_at.lt]** : `2021-01-15T23:00:00.000Z` (optional)
`ISO 8601`. Appointments that was created before the given date and time.
    + Default: All appointments.

Parameters:

+ id: `df0a308e-a6e3-435a-aef6-f51cd0e29747` (required) - ID of appointment to retrieve

delete.description:
Parameters:

+ **id**: `26c087b8-022a-4cd8-a766-5dd6da0bb78b` (required) - [Appointment](#appointments) id
+ **deletion_strategy**: (enum[string], optional) If the appointment is a part of a recurring series (e.g. every Monday at 08:00), you can control which appointments in that series are deleted in addition to this appointment.
    + Default: `only_this`
    + Members
        + `only_this`
        + `this_and_following`
        + `all`

patch.description:
Parameters

+ id: `6da0dabe-b122-4b62-af81-479861ea6451` (required) - ID of the appointment to accept

Parameters:

+ **appointment_id**: `6da0dabe-b122-4b62-af81-479861ea6451` (required) - ID of the appointment to cancel
+ **inform_customer**: `true` (optional) - Informs the customer about the cancelation if `true`
    + Default: `false`

meta.reason: The optional reason why the appointment was canceled

get.description: Retrieve which slots are availability for appointments for given parameters.

parameters.name: required_capacity
parameters.description: The number of participants for this service combination (required Int)

parameters.name: search_weeks_range
parameters.description: How many weeks ahead of ends_at to look for next appointment (required Int)

parameters.name: starts_at
parameters.description: When to start looking for slots (required Time)

parameters.name: ends_at
parameters.description: When to stop looking for slots (required Time that must be greater than starts_at)

parameters.name: services_resources[][service_id]
parameters.description: One service to generate the slots for (required at least one, String)

parameters.name: services_resources[][resource_id]
parameters.description: Resource to generate the slots for (optional String for each service_id)

get.description:
Parameters:

+ **page[number]**: `2` (number, optional) Pagination results page to respond with. First page is 1
(see [pagination](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination))
    + Default: 1
+ **page[size]**: `4` (number, optional) Maximum number of result per page. Max is 20
(see [pagination](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination))
    + Default: 10
+ **include**: resources (optional) Comma-separated (i.e. %2C) list of relationships to include in the response. By default no relationships are included (see [relationships](#closing_times) and [inclusion of related resources](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-includes))
+ **filter[merchant]** : `08d4cace-d873-4bb2-999e-883b102a4df6` (optional) Comma separated list of merchant id(s).
    + Default: All merchants available for requesting account.
+ **filter[resource.identity]** : `08d4cace-d873-4bb2-999e-883b102a4df6` (optional) Comma separated list of resource id(s).
    + Default: All resources available for requesting account.
+ **filter[starts_at.gt]**: `2020-10-28T12:00:00+01:00` (string, optional) Datetime string in ISO8601 format to return all closing times that starts after the datetime
    + Default: All closing times with any starts_at
+ **filter[starts_at.lt]**: `2020-10-28T12:00:00+01:00` (string, optional) Datetime string in ISO8601 format to return all closing times that starts beforethe datetime
    + Default: All closing times with any starts_at
+ **filter[ends_at.gt]**: `2020-10-28T12:00:00+01:00` (string, optional) Datetime string in ISO8601 format to return all closing times that ends after the datetime
    + Default: All closing times with any ends_at
+ **filter[ends_at.lt]**: `2020-10-28T12:00:00+01:00` (string, optional) Datetime string in ISO8601 format to return all closing times that ends beforethe datetime
    + Default: All closing times with any ends_at
+ **filter[updated_at.gt]** : `2020-10-28T12:00:00+01:00` (string, optional) Datetime string in ISO8601 format to return all closing times updated after the datetime
    + Default: All closing times with any updated_at
+ **filter[recurring]** : true,false (boolean, optional) Comma separated boolean to filter resources that were recurring. Send `true,false` when you want to display all of the resources (recurring or not).
    + Default: `true,false`
+ **filter[absences]** : true,false (boolean, optional) Comma separated boolean to filter resources that were absences. Send `true,false` when you want to display all of the resources (absences or not).
    + Default: `true,false`
+ **filter[closed_dates]** : true,false (boolean, optional) Comma separated boolean to filter resources that were closed_dates. Send `true,false` when you want to display all of the resources (closed_dates or not).
    + Default: `true,false`
+ **filter[deleted]**: true,false (boolean, optional) Comma separated boolean to filter resources that were soft deleted. Send `true,false` when you want to display all of the resources (deleted or not).
    + Default: `false`.

get.description:
Parameters

+ **page[number]**: `2` (integer, optional) Pagination results page to respond with. First page is 1 (see [pagination](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination))
    + Default: 1
+ **page[size]**: `4` (integer, optional) Maximum number of result per page. Max is 50 (see [pagination](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination))
    + Default: 20
+ **include**: merchant (optional) Comma-separated (i.e. %2C) list of relationships to include in the response. By default no relationships are included (see [relationships](#appointments) and [inclusion of related resources](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-includes))
    + Members
      + `merchant`
      + `last_note`
+ **filter[merchant]** : `08d4cace-d873-4bb2-999e-883b102a4df6` (optional) Comma separated list of merchant id(s).
    + Default: All merchants available for requesting account.
+ **filter[given_name]** : `John` (string, optional) Comma separated list of given names.
    + Default: All customers with any given name.
+ **filter[surname]** : `Doe` (string, optional) Comma separated list of surnames.
    + Default: All customers with any surname.
+ **filter[phones.value]** : `+49 9999 9999999` (string, optional) Comma separated list of phone numbers.
    + Default: All customers with any phone number.
+ **filter[emails.value]** : `john.doe@shore.com` (string, optional) Comma separated list of emails.
    + Default: All customers with any email.
+ **filter[updated_at.gt]** : `2017-03-02T16:12:58+01:00` (string, optional) Datetime string in ISO8601 format to return all customers updated after the datetime
    + Default: All customers with any updated_at
+ **filter[tags]** : `short-hair` (string, optional) Comma separated list of tags.
    + Default: All customers with any tag.
+ **filter[deleted]** : true,false (boolean, optional) Comma separated boolean to filter customers that were soft deleted. Send `true,false` when you want to display all of the customers (deleted or not).
    + Default: `false`.

Parameters:

+ **customer_id** : `485b3418-eacc-49cb-8b44-6b2023423f78` (string, required) - The customer's identifier
+ **include**: merchant (optional) Comma-separated (i.e. %2C) list of relationships to include in the response. By default no relationships are included (see [relationships](#appointments) and [inclusion of related resources](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-includes))
    + Members
      + `merchant`
      + `last_note`

post.description:
Creates a new customer or updates an existing customer that matches the given
request body.

attributes.content: This is a note about a customer.

get.description:
Parameters:

+ **page[number]**: `2` (integer, optional). Pagination results page to respond with. First page is 1 (see [pagination](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination))
    + Default: 1
+ **page[size]**: `4` (integer, optional). Maximum number of result per page. Max is 50 (see [pagination](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination))
    + Default: 20
+ **filter[customer]** : `586075f1-42a6-4837-bb13-6a9652d324f5` (string, optional)
Comma separated list of customer id(s).
    + Default: No value.
+ **filter[merchant_account]** : `df132932-cb3d-448d-91b2-120ab6444964` (string, optional)
Comma separated list of merchant account id(s).
    + Default: No value.
+ **filter[updated_at.gt]** : `2017-07-27T07:03:50.642Z` (string, optional)
Datetime string in ISO8601 format to return all customer notes updated after the datetime.
    + Default: No value.
+ **filter[deleted]** : true,false (boolean, optional) Comma separated boolean to filter customer notes that were soft deleted. Send `true,false` when you want to display all of the customer notes (deleted or not).
    + Default: `false`.
+ **sort**: (enum[string], optional) By default customer notes are sorted by when they were created.
    + Default: `created_at`
    + Members
        + `created_at`
        + `-created_at`

attributes.content: This is a note about a customer.
This is a note about a customer.

post.description:
Releasing a newsletter causes it to be asynchronously sent to it's customers
and customer groups.

Parameters:

+ `id`: `5eebffd8-197e-49c4-8fd4-6b4bea086dde` (required) - id of the newsletter to release
+ `scheduled_for`: `2017-06-10T12:00:00.000000Z` (optional) -
[ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the
newsletter should be scheduled to be released. If not given, then the
newsletter is released immediately

parameters.name: scheduled_for
parameters.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the newsletter should be scheduled to be released. If not given, then the newsletter is released immediately

get.description:
Parameters

+ **order_id**: `50f32ce1-fd79-46f2-8d43-c354703f34ef` (required, string) - [Order](#orders) id

Parameters:

+ **filter[merchant]** : `08d4cace-d873-4bb2-999e-883b102a4df6` (optional)
Comma separated list of merchant id(s).
    + Default: Sum of all merchants orders fees available for requesting account.
+ **filter[created.gt]** : `2017-01-15T23:00:00.000Z` (optional)
[ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601). Order that created after the given date and time.
    + Default: Sum of all merchant's orders fees.
+ **filter[created.lt]** : `2017-01-15T23:00:00.000Z` (optional)
[ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601). Order that created before the given date and time.
    + Default: Sum of all merchant's orders fees.

attributes.message: Gentile cliente, Le ricordiamo il suo appuntamento presso Matt' Barber Shop
Bonjour, nous souhaiterions vous rappeler votre rendez-vous chez nous.
Sehr geehrte(r) Patient/-in, hiermit möchten wir Sie an Ihren Termin bei Frau Dr. Bravin-Jumpertz erinnern.
Dear Customer, this is a friendly reminder of your appointment with us.

Ciao, ti ricordiamo il tuo appuntamento presso La Barbieria di Milano
Ti aspettiamo a Buccinasco in via Emilia,3
Hallo, dies ist die automatische Terminerinnerung von kosmetikzimmerchen.de - Wir freuen uns auf Ihren Besuch.
Estimado cliente, deseamos recordarle su cita en el Salon de belleza Maria Gans
Gentile cliente, le ricordiamo l´appuntamento
En Treska Peluqueros deseamos volver a verte ¡Reserva a través de nuestra web o Facebook!
Lieber Kunde, hiermit möchten wir Sie an Ihren Termin in unserem Haus erinnern

Pagination

* `page[number]` (number, optional)
	* Default: `1`
* `page[size]` (number, optional)
	* Default: `10`

Filters

* `filter[merchant]` (uuid)
* `filter[resource]` (uuid)
* `filter[starts_at.gt]` (datetime)
* `filter[starts_at.lt]` (datetime)

* `filter[ends_at.lt]` (datetime)
* `filter[updated_at.gt]` (datetime)

post.description:
Attributes

* `ends_at` (datetime) (required)
* `kind` (string) (required) - One of the following values:
	* `available`
	* `absence.out_of_office`
	* `absence.vacation`
	* `absence.sickness`
	* `absence.training`
	* `absence.school`
* `resource_uuid` (uuid) (required)
* `starts_at` (datetime) (required)
* `relationships[merchant]` (object) (required)
```
	"data": {
    	"type": "merchants",
    	"id": "e8222593-d4dd-4b2e-9ba1-7dbbd65c17d8"
    }
```
* `relationships[resource]` (object) (required)
```
	"data": {
    	"type": "resources",
    	"id": "e8222593-d4dd-4b2e-9ba1-7dbbd65c17d8"
    }
```

patch.description:
Attributes

* `ends_at` (datetime)
* `kind` (string) - One of the following values:
	* `available`
	* `absence.out_of_office`
	* `absence.vacation`
	* `absence.sickness`
	* `absence.training`
	* `absence.school`
* `resource_uuid` (uuid)
* `starts_at` (datetime)

post.description:
To create a recurring shift you should send one request per day using the [iCalendar spec](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2445).

A field called `recurrence_rule` following this format: `FREQ=WEEKLY;COUNT=99`.

Since the shift plan is designed on weekly basis, you should always send FREQ as WEEKLY. And also we want to simulate a "forever" recurring shift. For that we just following the convention of sending `COUNT=99`, meaning 99 weeks (~ 2 years). We will define a way to update this after the first release.

`exception_dates` is also from iCalendar spec, meaning an array of exceptions on the recurring dates. 

`duration_in_minutes` is self explanatory, if you want to create a recurring appointment from 9am to 9:42am you should pass 42 in this field, that's it.

`kind` is the type of the shift, like available or absence.vacation for example.

`resource_id` field is the uuid of the employee / resource that will be affected by this recurring shift.

`starts_at` the datetime when the recurring should start.

patch.description:
While updating a recurring shift you can pass only the attributes that you want to change

`recurrence_rule` if you want to update the number of times the recurrence must repeat. Might not be used for now, since we are only repeating "forever". But it is available.

`exceptions_date` if you want to add or remove exceptions to the recurring shift.

`duration_in_minutes` when you want to change the ending of the recurring.

`kind` when you want to change the type of shift. For example, changing from available to vacation.

`resource_ids` when you want to update, notice that if you update this field, it will not keep the resources previously applied; so you should send all the resources that you want to be part of this shift.

`starts_at` when you want to update the date the recurring starts.

delete.description:
When the merchant wants to delete a recurring shift, the client should send one delete request per day.

Just pass the id of and make delete request. It will delete all the shifts that were created  for this recurrence.

post.description:
Our [OAuth2 token endpoint](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-3.2)
 supports [password](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.3)
 and [refresh_token](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-6) grant types.

get.description:
Pagination

* `page[number]` (number, optional)
	* Default: `1`
* `page[size]` (number, optional)
	* Default: `10`

Filters

* `filter[merchant]` (uuid)

+ Parameters
    + id: `df0a308e-a6e3-435a-aef6-f51cd0e29747` (required) -
      [Promo Code](#promo_code) id

attributes.message: Gentile cliente, Le ricordiamo il suo appuntamento presso Matt' Barber Shop

tags.name: Appointments
tags.description: Appointments conform to [json:api](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects) specification. Appointments are entries in an employee's Shore calendar. The appointment may or may not be with a [customer](#the-customer-object). The appointment can be a part of a recurring series (e.g. every Monday at 08:00). In that case, the appointment is a specific occurrence in that series (e.g. Monday, January 2nd, 2017 at 08:00). ## The appointment object Appointments conform to [json:api](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects) specification. + **id** (string) - (read-only, non-null) **Example:** df0a308e-a6e3-435a-aef6-f51cd0e29747 + **type** - (non-updatable, non-null) The value is always `appointments`. + **attributes** (object) + `title` - The title of an appointment + `starts_at` - (non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the appointment starts. + `customer_starts_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the appointment starts for the customer. + `ends_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the appointment ends. + `color` - The color of the box displayed on the calendar. + `subject` - A short description of the appointment. + `participant_count` (number) - The number of people that will be present on the appointment. + `state` - (read-only) The current state of the series (`pending`, `accepted` or `canceled`). + `no_show` - (non-creatable) The flag that represents if the customer attended the appointment + `service_ids` - (opt-in, array) List of service ids. This field is a temporary solution in order to support appointments created with the old widget. + `attachment_ids` - (non-null, opt-in, array) List of attachment ids + `state_changed_by` - (read-only) Who last changed the state + `deleted` (boolean) - (read-only) Flag that specified if the appointment was soft deleted. + `origin` - (non-updatable, opt-in) Which platform created this appointment. + `cost` (object) - (read-only) + `amount` (number) - (read-only) The price of the appointment in the currency's cents (e.g. 199 if the price is $1.99). + `currency` - (read-only) The [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) code of the currency which the appointment will be charged (e.g. `USD`). + `booked_via` - (read-only) The source this appointment was created from + `additional_information` (object) - (read-only) + `custom_attributes` (object) - (read-only) The custom attributes that comes from booking service + `reason_for_booking` (string) - (read-only) The reason for booking when the merchant does not have services and customer books something from booking service + `additional_information_archive` (object) - (read-only) The additional information sent via booking service + `address` (object) - The address where the appointment will take place (the merchant's address by default). + `line1` + `line2` + `city` + `state` + `postal_code` + `country` - The [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) code of the country. + `steps` (array) - Steps performed during the appointment. + (object) + `name` - The step's name. + `break` (boolean) - A flag specifing if the step is a break between two steps. + `with_customer` (boolean) - A flag specifing if the customer is present during the step. + `duration` (number) - The duration of the steps in minutes. + `resource_ids` (array[string]) - The `id` of the [resources](#resources) that will be perform the step. Example: `["e149263a-073c-4ada-ae62-1f7102368e05"]`. + `rules` (array) - Recursion rules or `null` if this appointment is not part of a recurring series. + (object) + `count` (number) - Number of times this rule is applied or `null` if `ends_at` set + `ends_at` - [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when this rule ends or `null` if `count` set + `frequency` - `daily`, `weekly` or `monthly` + `interval` (number) - Interval skipped during recursion (e.g. if `frequency` = `daily` and `interval` = `3`, then rule is "every third day") + `starts_at` - [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when this rule starts + `created_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the appointment was created. + `updated_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the appointment was updated last. + **meta** (object) + `action_required` (boolean) + `waiting_for_customer` (boolean) + **links** (object) + `accept` - URL to the accept action for this appointment if it can be accepted by the current user + `cancel` - URL to the cancel action for this appointment if it can be canceled by the current user + **relationships** (object) + `merchant` (object) - (non-null) [Merchant](#the-merchant-object) this appointment belongs to. + `merchant_accounts` (object) - (non-null) [Employees](#the-employee-object), if any, responsible for the appointment. + `attachments` (object) - (non-null) [Attachments](#the-attachment-object), if any, the references for attachments on file_service + `customer` (object) - [Customer](#the-customer-object), if any, attending this appointment. + `series` (object) - (read-only, non-null) [Series](#the-series-object) this appointment belongs to. + `resources` (object) - (read-only, non-null) [Resources](#the-resource-object), if any, that will be required during the appointment (see steps). + `services` (object) - (non-null) [Services](#the-service-object), if any, performed during the appointment.

tags.name: Availability
Closing Times
tags.description: A [closing time](#the-closing_time-object) is a register to block appointments. [Resources](#the-resource-object) usually have a [closing time](#the-closing-time-object) to block a holiday or for other reason. [Closing times](#the-closing-time-object) conform to [json:api](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects) specification. Furthermore, the endpoints support [pagination](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination) and [filtering](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-filtering). ## The closing time object Attributes: + **id** (string, required) - **Read only** `uuid`. **Example:** 485b3418-eacc-49cb-8b44-6b2023423f78. + **type** (required, string) - Value is `"closing_times"`. + **attributes** (object) + `starts_at` (string) - Format: `ISO 8601`. + `ends_at` (string) - Format: `ISO 8601`. + `reason` (string) - Example: `"holiday"` + `created_at` - **Read only** Format: `ISO 8601`. + `updated_at` - **Read only** Format: `ISO 8601`. + `deleted` (boolean) - **Read only** Flag that specified if the customer was soft deleted. + **relationships** + `merchant` (object, required) - [Merchant](#the-merchant-object) to which this closing time belongs. + `resources` (array) - (required) [Resource](#the-resource-object) to which this closing time belongs.

tags.name: Customers
tags.description: A [customer](#the-customer-object) is a [merchant's](#the-merchant-object) contact information for a person. [Customers](#the-customer-object) usually have had an [appointment](#the-appointment-object) with the [merchant](#the-merchant-object) or will in the future. ## The customer object [Customers](#the-customer-object) conform to the [JSON API](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects) specification. Attributes: + **id** (string, required) - **Read only** `uuid`. **Example:** 485b3418-eacc-49cb-8b44-6b2023423f78. + **type** (required, string) - Value is `"customers"`. + **attributes** (object) + `opt_in` (boolean) - Value specifying if customer accepts newsletters and promotions by email. + `opt_in_origin` (string) - Origin of the request. Example: `"app-shell"`. + `prefix` (string) + `given_name` (string) + `surname` (string) + `middle_name` (string) + `suffix` (string) + `birthdate` (string) - Format: `ISO 8601`. + `tags` (array[string]) - List of tags for the user. Example: `["short-hair"]`. + `created_at` - **Read only** Format: `ISO 8601`. + `updated_at` - **Read only** Format: `ISO 8601`. + `deleted` (boolean) - **Read only** Flag that specified if the customer was soft deleted. + `phones` (array) + (object) + `name` (string) - Example: `"home"` + `value` (string) + `emails` (array) + (object) + `name` (string) - Example: `"personal"`. + `value` (string) + `addresses` (array) + (object) + `name` (string) - Example: `"shipping"` + `line1` (string) + `line2` (string) + `city` (string) + `state` (string) + `country` (string) - The `ISO 3166-1 alpha-2` code of the country. + `postal_code` (string) + `vip` (boolean) + `gender` (string) - Customer gender (`male`, `female`) + `custom_attributes` (array) + (object) + `definition_id` - The `uuid` of the definition for this custom_attribute. + `value` - A valid value from the type of the [definition](#the-customer-attribute-definition-object). + `type` - **Read only** The type of the definition, return to facilitate the construltion of parsers. + **relationships** + `merchant` (object, required) - [Merchant](#the-merchant-object) to which this Customer belongs. + `last_note` (object) - (read-only) Last created and not deleted [note](#the-customer-note-object) for this customer + `customer_attribute_definitions` (object) - [Customer Attribute Definitions](#the-customer-attribute-definition-object) for the custom attributes set on this customer.

tags.name: Customer notes
tags.description: A [customer note](#the-customer-note-object) is a comment from a [merchant account](#merchant_accounts) regarding a [customer](#the-customer-object). Notes are not visible to the [customer](#the-customer-object) they are about. ## The customer note object [Customer notes](#customer_notes) conform to the [JSON API](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects) specification. Attributes: + id - (read-only, non-null) **Example:** 485b3418-eacc-49cb-8b44-6b2023423f78 + type - (non-updatable, non-null) The value is always `customer_notes`. + attributes (object) + `content` - (non-updatable, non-null) The actual text content of the note. + `created_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the note was created + `updated_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the note was last updated + `deleted` (boolean) - (read-only, non-null) `true` if the note was soft-deleted, otherwise `false` + relationships + `merchant_account` (object) - (read-only, non-null) [Merchant Account](#merchant_accounts) to which this note belongs to + `customer` (object) - (read-only, non-null) [Customer](#customers) to which this note belongs to

tags.name: Employees
tags.description: An [employee](#the-employee-object) is a [merchant's](#the-merchant-object) contact information for a person. [Employee](#the-employee-object) belongs to [organization](#the-organization-object) and might be associated with many [merchants](#the-merchant-object). ## The employee object [Employee](#the-employee-object) conform to the [JSON API](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects) specification. Attributes: + **id** (string, required) - **Read only** `uuid`. **Example:** 485b3418-eacc-49cb-8b44-6b2023423f78. + **type** (required, string) - Value is `"employees"`. + **attributes** (object) + `given_name` (string) + `surname` (string) + `phone` (string) + `email` (string) + `email_confirmed` (string) + `image_url` (string) + `birthday` (string) + `color` (string) Format: "#bdd7a5" + `only_login` (boolean) + `external_id` (string) + `address` (array) + (object) + `city` (string) + `postal_code` (string) + `street` (string) + **relationships** + `merchants` (object, required) - [Merchant](#the-merchant-object) to which this Employee belongs. + `organization` (object, required) - [Organization](#the-organization-object) to which this Employee belongs. + `merchant_account` (object, required) - [Merchant Account](#the-merchant-account-object) to which this Employee belongs. + `resources` (object, required) - [Resource](#the-resource-object) to which this Employee belongs.

tags.name: User Profile
tags.description: A `user profile` is a current merchant_account settings for organization.

tags.name: Merchants
tags.description: Merchants are the branch offices of an organization. An organization can have one or more merchants. For example, a multi-national organization might have a merchant in New York and another in London. Each merchant can be configured separately from the others. They have their own distinct customers, resources, services, appointments etc. Some things, such as employees, belong to the organization and are therefore shared between all merchants. A merchant's appointments take place by default at the their address. For UI_visibility see [rails spec](https://github.com/shore-gmbh/core/blob/master/spec/services/merchant_account/ui_visibility_spec.rb) or [slack-thread](https://shore-chat.slack.com/archives/GV6VCCL0N/p1595489683001400) ## The merchant object Attributes: + `id` (string) - (read-only, non-null) **Example:** df0a308e-a6e3-435a-aef6-f51cd0e29747 + `type` - (non-updatable, non-null) The value is always `merchants`. + attributes (object) + `name` - The name of the merchant + `slug` - (non-null) + `phone` + `locale` - (non-null) + `organization_id` - (non-null) + `time_zone` - (non-null) + `address` (object) + `line1` - (non-null) + `city` - (non-null) + `state` - (null) + `postal_code` - (non-null) + `country` - (non-null) + `sms_sender_name` + `email_sender_name` + `opening_hours` (object) + `booking_hours` (object) + `display_appointment_duration` (number) + `max_lead_time` (number) + `min_lead_time` (number) + `open_bitmap` - (non-null) + `booking_bitmap` - (non-null) + `shiftplan` (boolean) + `direct_bookable` (boolean) - (opt-in) + `feature_toggles` (object) - (opt-in) + `ui_visibility` (object) - (opt-in) + `employee` - (object) + `user_profile` - (object) + `email_hint_text` - (opt-in) + `suspended` (boolean) + `enabled_payments` (array[string]) + `category` + `cancelation_time` + `service_steps_enabled` (boolean) + `participant_count_enabled` (boolean) - (opt-in,read-only,non-null) `true` if [appointments](#appointments-the-appointments-object) for this merchant should be created with a non-null `participant_count`, otherwise false + `source` - (opt-in,non-updatable) string marking how this merchant was created (e.g. `Weebly` if merchant created via the Weebly integration) or `null` if not known + `social_media_links` (object) + `twitter` - (null) + `facebook` - (null) + `instagram` - (null) + `description`

tags.name: Newsletters
tags.description: ## The newsletter object Attributes: + `id` - (read-only, non-null) **Example:** 7f175e52-e537-427e-b1a9-dd7fecb0f555 + `type` - (non-updatable, non-null) The value is always `newsletters`. + `attributes` (object) + `kind` - (non-updatable, non-null) `email` or `sms` + `locale` - (non-null) [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) locale + `variables` (object) - (non-null) + `recipients_count` (number) - (non-null) estimated number of recipients + `customer_groups` (array) - (non-null) names of the customer groups, if any, this newsletter will be sent to + `created_at` - (non-updateable, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the newsletter was created + `updated_at` - (non-updateable, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the newsletter was last updated + `scheduled_for` - (non-updateable) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the newsletter is scheduled to be released or `null` if it is not scheduled at all + `released_at` - (non-updateable) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the newsletter was released or `null` if it has not been released yet + relationships (object) + `merchant` (object) - (non-updateable, non-null) [Merchant](#merchants) this newsletter belongs to + `template` (object) - (non-updateable, non-null) [Template](#templates) used to render this newsletter + `customers` (object) - (non-null) [Customers](#customers), if any, this newsletter will be explicitly sent to. NOTE: this is NOT the list of customers that can be found in the `customer_groups`.

tags.name: Orders
tags.description: The purchase of several items (see `order_items` attribute) is represented by an order. These `order_items` can be [services](#services) or any other cart items. An order can have multiple [payments](#payments) and multiple [refunds](#refunds). An order always belongs to a [merchant](#merchants) (who receives the payments), and can belong to a [customer](#customers) (who pays for this order). ## The orders object [/v2/orders/{id}] Orders conform to the [JSON API](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects) specification. + id (string) - (read-only, non-null) **Example:** 5598b86f-7c8c-45ad-a1ed-0d9ae8ed7e60 + type (string) - (non-updatable, non-null) The value is always `orders`. + attributes (object) + `gateway` - (non-null) Payment gateway for all the [payments](#payments) belonging this order (`stripe`, `gastrofix`, `tillhub`, `epages`, `square`) + `gateway_id` - Internal ID in the source system (gateway). Must be unique to this [merchant](#merchants) and `gateway` + `total` (object) + `amount` (number) - Total amount, including all taxes in the smallest currency unit (for example in cents for EUR). Negative integer means that it's some kind of expenditure (the [merchant](#merchants) pays to someone). + `currency` - Should be always the same as the parent [merchant](#merchant)'s default currency + `status` - (read-only) `paid` when the order has succeeded [payments](#payments) with the `total` amount. Newly created orders has `created` status by default. All available options are (`created`, `partially_paid`, `paid`). + `refund_status` - (read-only) All available options are (`not_refunded`, `partially_refunded`, `refunded`). + `description` - Additional free text information about the order. + `initiated_at` - (non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the order was initiated. + `created_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the order was created. + `order_items` (array) - List of items were paid with this order. Total of `order_items` (`unit_price` * `quantity`) should be equal with `total`. + (object) + `name` + `type` - (read-only) (`cart_item`, `service`) + `quantity` + `unit_price` (object) + `amount` + `currency` - same currency as for the order. + `tax` (object) + `type` - tax type (`value_added_tax`, `sales_tax`). + `rate` - tax percentage as a decimal number (for example 0.19 for 19%) + `name` - name of the tax. + relationships (object) + `merchant` (object) - (non-null) [Merchant](#merchants) this order belongs to. + `customer` (object) - [Customer](#customers) this order belongs to, if any. + `appointment` (object) - [Appointment](#appointments) this order belongs to, if any. + `payments` (object) - array of [Payments](#payments) belong to this order. + `refunds` (object) - (read-only) if any, array of [Refunds](#refunds) belong to this order.

tags.name: Payments
tags.description: This resource represents a (full or partial) payment for an existing [order](#orders) with one payment method. All payments belong to an [order](#orders). Payments conform to the [JSON API](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects) specification. + Attributes + id (string) - (read-only, non-null) **Example:** 5598b86f-7c8c-45ad-a1ed-0d9ae8ed7e60 + type (string) - (non-updatable, non-null) The value is always `payments`. + attributes (object) + `gateway_id` - Internal ID in the source system (gateway). Must be unique to this [order](#orders) + `paid` (object) + `amount` (number) - (non-null) Total amount which was paid with this payment, in the smallest currency unit (for example in cents for EUR). Negative integer means that it's some kind of expenditure (the [merchant](#merchants) paid to someone). + `currency` - (read-only) Always the same as the parent [merchant](#merchant)'s default currency + `status` - (read-only) `succeeded` when the payment has succeeded, `not_captured` when a Stripe charge is initiated but not captured yet + `statement_descriptor` - An arbitrary string which was displayed on the customer's credit card statement. + `description` - Additional free text information about the payment. + `paid_at` - (non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the payment was initiated. + `created_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the payment was created. + `payment_type` - (non-null) method of payment: supported values (`cash`, `card`, `other`). + `payment_details` (object) + `brand` - Credit card brand. + `last4` - Last 4 number of the credit card number or SEPA account number. + `expiration` - Expiration date of the credit card. + `billing_address` (object) + `name` + `email` + `address` (object) + `line1` + `line2` + `city` + `postal_code` + `state` + `country` - The [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) code of the country. + relationships (object) + `order` (object) - (non-null) [Order](#orders) belong to this payment.

tags.name: Refunds
tags.description: The refund represents a full or partial pay back for an existing [order](#orders). All refunds belong to an [order](#orders). ## The refund object [/v2/refunds/{id}] Refunds conform to the [JSON API](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects) specification. Attributes: + id (string) - (read-only, non-null) **Example:** 50f32ce1-fd79-46f2-8d43-c354703f34ef + type (string) - (non-updatable, non-null) The value is always `refunds`. + attributes (object) + `gateway_id` - Internal ID in the source system. + `refunded` (object) + `amount` (number) - (non-null) Total refunded amount in the smallest currency unit (for example in cents for EUR). Should be a positive integer. + `currency` - (read-only) Always the same as the parent [order](#orders)'s currency. + `refunded_at` - (non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the refund was initiated. + `created_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the refund was created. + `status` - (read-only) A newly created refund is always has `succeeded` status. Status can be (`pending`, `succeeded`, `failed` `cancelled`). + `reason` - Reason for the the refund (`requested_by_customer`, `requested_by_merchant`, `duplicate`, `fraudulent`, `other`). + relationships (object) + order (object) - (non-null) parent [Order](#orders) for this refund.

tags.name: Resources
tags.description: A [resource](#the-resource-object) is an abstraction representing a person, a table, a room, or a rental employed/owned by a [merchant](#the-merchant-object). Resources are usually booked (or at least blocked) in combination with [appointments](#the-appointment-object) by [customers](#the-customer-object). [Resources](#the-resource-object) conform to [json:api](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects) specification. Furthermore, the endpoints support [pagination](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination) and [filtering](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-filtering). Resources have non-editable attributes such as `name` and `resource_type`. If these non-editable attributes are supposed to be updated, a new resource should be created instead. ## The resource object Attributes: + id - (read-only, non-null) **Example:** df0a308e-a6e3-435a-aef6-f51cd0e29747 + type - (non-updatable, non-null) The value is always `resources`. + attributes (object) + `name` - (non-updatable, non-null) A name of the resource + `resource_type` - (non-updatable) The kind of resource (`room`, `employee`, `table`, `rental`) + `color` - Hexadecimal color value or `null` if this resource does not have a color + `created_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the resource was created. + `updated_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the resource was updated last. + `position` (number) - (non-null, opt-in) A position in the list of resources + `max_participants` (number, opt-in) - How many people this resource can handle in a single booking + `max_parallel` (number, opt-in) - How many bookings this resource may be apart of at any given time + `visible_to_customers` (boolean, opt-in) - Should be displayed in the booking service + `booking_hours` (object, opt-in) - A schedule when the resource is available for booking. Example: `"monday": ["10:15-11:20", "20:30-23:55"]` + `all_services` (boolean) - (read-only, non-null, opt-in) `true` if this resource can perform all of the merchant's services, otherwise false + `available_bitmap` - (read-only, opt-in) bitmap of available hours or `null` + `deleted` (boolean) - **Read only** Flag that specified if the resource was soft deleted. + relationships (object) + `merchant` (object) (non-updatable, non-null) [Merchant](#the-merchant-object) this resource belongs to. + `services` (object) - (non-null) [Services](#the-service-object), if any, this resource can perform. + `employee` (object) (non-updatable, non-null) [Employee](#the-employee-object) this resource belongs to.

tags.name: Series
tags.description: Series](#series) contain a group of one or more that belong together. The recurrence rules determine when the [appointments](#appointments) take place. The other attributes (e.g. color, subject, etc.) are inherited by the [appointments](#appointments) in this series. ## The series object [Series](#series) conform to [json:api](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects) specification. Attributes: + **id** - (read-only, non-null) **Example:** df0a308e-a6e3-435a-aef6-f51cd0e29747 + **type** - (non-updatable, non-null) The value is always `series`. + **attributes** (object) + `color` - The color each [appointment](#appointments) box is displayed in the calendar. + `subject` - A short description of each [appointment](#appointments). + `participant_count` (number) - The number of people that will be present at the [appointment](#appointments). + `cost` (object) - (read-only) + `amount` (number) - (read-only, opt-in) The price of each [appointment](#appointments) in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents if the price is $1.00). + `currency` - (read-only, opt-in) The [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) code of the price's currency for each [appointment](#appointments) (e.g. `USD` if price is in US dollars). + `address` (object) - The address where the [appointment](#appointments) will take place (the [merchant's](#merchants) address by default). + `line1` + `line2` + `city` + `state` + `postal_code` + `country` - The [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) code of the country. + `steps` (array) - Steps performed during the [appointment](#appointments). + (object) + `name` - The step's name. + `break` (boolean) - A flag specifing if the step is a break between two steps. + `with_customer` (boolean) - A flag specifing if the customer is present during the step. + `duration` (number) - The duration of the steps in minutes. + `resource_ids` (array[string]) - The `id` of the [resources](#resources) that will be perform the step. Example: `["e149263a-073c-4ada-ae62-1f7102368e05"]`. + `recurrence_rules` (array) - The rules that will be used to create the [appointments](#appointments) in this series. + (object) + `starts_at` - (non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the first [appointment](#appointments) in the series starts + `interval` (number) - (non-null) The interval between each appointment. See `frequency` for the unit of this interval. + `frequency` (enum[string]) - (non-null) The unit of the interval (i.e. `daily`, `weekly` or `monthly`). + `ends_at` - [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the series ends or `null` if the series never ends. + `count` (number) - The number of appointments to create. + `created_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the series was created. + `updated_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the series was updated last. + **relationships** (object) + `merchant` (object) - (non-null) [Merchant](#merchants) this series belongs to. + `merchant_accounts` (object) - (non-null) [Employees](#merchant_accounts), if any, responsible for each [appointment](#appointments). + `customer` (object) - [Customer](#customers), if any, attending each [appointment](#appointments). + `resources` (object) - (read-only, non-null) [Resources](#resources), if any, that will be required during each [appointment](#appointments) (see steps). + `services` (object) - (non-null) [Services](#services), if any, performed during each [appointment](#appointments).

tags.name: Services
tags.description: A [service](#the-service-object) is an abstraction representing something that is sold by a [merchant](#the-merchant-object). Services are usually booked in combination with [appointments](#the-appointment-object) by [customers](#the-customer-object). [Services](#the-service-object) conform to the json:api specification. ## The service object [Services](#the-service-object) conform to [json:api](http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects) specification. Furthermore, the endpoints support [pagination](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination) and [filtering](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-filtering). Services have not-editable attributes such as `name`, `steps`, `cost`, `currency` and `identity`. In case when these not editable attributes are needed to be updated, a new service should be created. The attribute `identity` is used to keep track and group these entities. Attributes: + **id** - (read-only, non-null) **Example:** df0a308e-a6e3-435a-aef6-f51cd0e29747 + **type** - (non-updatable, non-null) The value is always `services`. + **attributes** (object) + `name` - (non-updatable) A name of the service. + `identity` - (non-updatable) A common identifier for grouping services + `steps` (array) - (non-updatable) (at least one required). A template for appointment steps + (object) + `name` - The step's name + `break` (boolean) - A flag specifing if the step is a break between two steps + `duration` (number) - Duration of the step in minutes + `with_customer` (boolean) - A flag specifing if the customer is present during the step + `created_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the resource was created. + `updated_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the resource was updated last. + `description` - (opt-in) A desctiption of the service + `cost` (object) - (read-only) + `amount` (number) - (read-only, opt-in) The service price in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents if the price is $1.00). + `currency` - (read-only, opt-in) The [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) code of the price's currency for each service (e.g. `USD` if price is in US dollars). + `visible_to_customers` (boolean, opt-in) - Should be displayed in the booking service + `active` (boolean) - (read-only, opt-in) Active services are shown in the list of services + **relationships** (object) + merchant (object) - (non-null) [Merchant](#the-merchant-object) this service belongs to. + resources (object) - (non-null) [Resources](#the-resource-object) that can perform this [service](#the-service-object)

tags.name: Service categories
tags.description: A [service category](#service_categories) is a collection of [services](#services). ## The service category object Attributes: + id - (read-only, non-null) **Example:** df0a308e-a6e3-435a-aef6-f51cd0e29747 + type - (non-updatable, non-null) The value is always `service_categories`. + attributes (object) + `name` - (non-null) Name of the category + `position` (number) - (read-only) Position of this category + `created_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the category was created. + `updated_at` - (read-only, non-null) [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the category was updated last. + relationships (object) + `merchant` (object) - (non-null) [Merchant](#merchants) this category belongs to. + `services` (object) - (non-null) [Services](#services), if any, belonging to this category.

tags.name: Shifts
tags.description:
Attributes

* `created_at` (datetime)
* `ends_at` (datetime)
* `kind` (string) - One of the following values:
	* `available`
	* `absence.out_of_office`
	* `absence.vacation`
	* `absence.sickness`
	* `absence.training`
	* `absence.school`
* `resource_uuid` (uuid)
* `starts_at` (datetime)
* `updated_at` (datetime)

Relationships

* `merchant`
* `resource`
* `shift_plan_template`

tags.name: Shifts Recurrences
tags.description:
When the merchant is creating a new shift, there is an option to make it recurring. If that's is the case, the client should use the ShiftRecurrence.

Attributes

* `ends_at` (datetime)
* `kind` (string) - One of the following values:
	* `available`
	* `absence.out_of_office`
	* `absence.vacation`
	* `absence.sickness`
	* `absence.training`
	* `absence.school`
* `resource_uuid` (uuid)
* `starts_at` (datetime)
* `duration_in_minutes` (integer)
* `exception_dates` (array of datetimes)
* `recurrence_rule` (string following iCalendar spec)
* `resource_ids` (array of integers)
* `merchant_profile_id` (uuid)

Filters

* `filter[merchant]` (uuid)

Relationships:

* `merchant`

tags.name: Shifts Plan Templates
tags.description:
Attributes

* `name` (string)
* `merchant_profile_uuid` (uuid)
* `shift_params` (array of objects, check the create request for examples)

Pagination

* `page[number]` (number, optional)
	* Default: `1`
* `page[size]` (number, optional)
	* Default: `10`

Filters

* `filter[merchant]` (uuid)


Relationships:

* `merchant`

tags.name: Tokens
tags.description:
Our API supports authentication via [OAuth2](https://oauth.net/2/). Credentials
 can be exchanged for
 [access tokens](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.4) and a
 [refresh tokens](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.5).

## Request a token

Our [OAuth2 token endpoint](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-3.2)
 supports [password](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.3)
 and [refresh_token](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-6) grant types.

tags.name: Wait List Customers
tags.description:
A wait list customer represents an entry in the wait list.

Attributes

* `created_at` (datetime)
* `customer_id` (uuid)
* `number_of_persons` (integer)
* `period` (datetime range)
* `updated_at` (datetime)

Relationships:

* `merchant`
* `service`

tags.name: Promo codes
tags.description: ## The promo_code object Attributes: + `id` - (read-only, non-null) **Example:** 7f175e52-e537-427e-b1a9-dd7fecb0f555 + `type` - (non-updatable, non-null) The value is always `promo_codes`. + `attributes` (object) + `promo_code` - (string) - (non-updatable, non-null) + `active` - (bool) - (non-updateable, non-null) + `percentage_off` - (integer) - (non-updateable) + `amount_off` - (integer) - (non-updateable) + `currency` - (string) - (non-updateable) + `duration` - (string) - (non-updateable) values `[once, repeating, forever]` + `duration_in_months` - (integer) - (non-updateable)
